      }\n+\n+            x +|= @intCast(render_len);\n+\n+            // Render divider after tab (except for last tab)\n+            if (idx + 1 < self.titles.len and x < area.right()) {\n+ @intCast(divider_render_len);\n+            }\n+        }\n+    }\n+\n+    /// Get the number of tabs\n+    pub fn count(self: Tabs) usize {\n+        return self.titles.len;\n+    }\n+\n+    /// {"type":"user","message":{"role":"user","content":[{"tool_use_id":"toolu_01M6twakne1HDXzVEybjKqjv","type":"tool_result","content":"     1// Paragraph widget for zithril TUI framework\n     2// Multi-line text with wrapping and alignment\n     3\n     4const std = @import(\"std\");\n     5const buffer_mod = @import(\"../buffer.zig\");\n     6const geometry = @import(\"../geometry.zig\");\n     7const style_mod = @import(\"../style.zig\");\n     8\n     9pub const Buffer = buffer_mod.Buffer;\n    10pub const Rect = geometry.Rect;\n    11pub const Style = style_mod.Style;\n    12\n    13/// Text wrapping modes\n    14pub const Wrap = enum {\n    15    /// No wrapping, clip at boundary\n    16    none,\n    17    /// Wrap at any character position\n    18    char,\n    19    /// Wrap at word boundaries (spaces)\n    20    word,\n    21};\n    22\n    23/// Text alignment options\n    24pub const Alignment = enum {\n    25    left,\n    26    center,\n    27    right,\n    28};\n    29\n    30/// Multi-line text widget with optional wrapping.\n    31///\n    32/// Renders text content across multiple lines with configurable wrapping\n    33/// behavior and alignment. Lines beyond the area height are not rendered.\n    34pub const Paragraph = struct {\n    35    /// The text content to display\n    36    text: []const u8,\n    37\n    38    /// Style applied to the text\n    39    style: Style = Style.empty,\n    40\n    41    /// Text wrapping mode\n    42    wrap: Wrap = .none,\n    43\n    44    /// Text alignment within each line\n    45    alignment: Alignment = .left,\n    46\n    47    /// Render the paragraph into the buffer at the given area.\n    48    /// Text is split into lines (either by newlines or wrapping) and rendered\n    49    /// until the area height is filled.\n    50    pub fn render(self: Paragraph, area: Rect, buf: *Buffer) void {\n    51        if (area.isEmpty()) return;\n    52        if (self.text.len == 0) return;\n    53\n    54        var y = area.y;\n    55        const max_y = area.bottom();\n    56\n    57        // Process text line by line (split by newlines first)\n    58        var line_iter = std.mem.splitScalar(u8, self.text, '\\n');\n    59        while (line_iter.next()) |logical_line| {\n    60            if (y >= max_y) break;\n    61\n    62            // Apply wrapping to this logical line\n    63            switch (self.wrap) {\n    64                .none => {\n    65                    self.renderLine(logical_line, area.x, y, area.width, buf);\n    66                    y += 1;\n    67                },\n    68                .char => {\n    69                    var remaining = logical_line;\n    70                    while (remaining.len > 0 and y < max_y) {\n    71                        const chunk_len = @min(remaining.len, area.width);\n    72                        const chunk = remaining[0..chunk_len];\n    73                        self.renderLine(chunk, area.x, y, area.width, buf);\n    74                        remaining = remaining[chunk_len..];\n    75                        y += 1;\n    76                    }\n    77                    // Empty line should still take a row\n    78                    if (logical_line.len == 0) {\n    79                        y += 1;\n    80                    }\n    81                },\n    82                .word => {\n    83                    if (logical_line.len == 0) {\n    84                        y += 1;\n    85                        continue;\n    86                    }\n    87                    var line_start: usize = 0;\n    88                    while (line_start < logical_line.len and y < max_y) {\n    89                        const wrap_end = findWordWrapEnd(logical_line[line_start..], area.width);\n    90                        const line = logical_line[line_start .. line_start + wrap_end];\n    91                        self.renderLine(line, area.x, y, area.width, buf);\n    92                        line_start += wrap_end;\n    93                        // Skip leading spaces on next line\n    94                        while (line_start < logical_line.len and logical_line[line_start] == ' ') {\n    95                            line_start += 1;\n    96                        }\n    97                        y += 1;\n    98                    }\n    99                },\n   100            }\n   101        }\n   102    }\n   103\n   104    /// Render a single line of text with alignment\n   105    fn renderLine(self: Paragraph, line: []const u8, x: u16, y: u16, width: u16, buf: *Buffer) void {\n   106        if (line.len == 0) return;\n   107\n   108        const text_len = textDisplayWidth(line);\n   109        const visible_len = @min(text_len, width);\n   110\n   111        if (visible_len == 0) return;\n   112\n   113        const x_offset: u16 = switch (self.alignment) {\n   114            .left => 0,\n   115            .center => (width -| visible_len) / 2,\n   116            .right => width -| visible_len,\n   117        };\n   118\n   119        buf.setString(x +| x_offset, y, line, self.style);\n   120    }\n   121};\n   122\n   123/// Find the end index for word wrapping within a max width.\n   124/// Returns the number of characters to include on this line.\n   125fn findWordWrapEnd(text: []const u8, max_width: u16) usize {\n   126    if (text.len == 0) return 0;\n   127\n   128    const width: usize = @intCast(max_width);\n   129    if (text.len <= width) return text.len;\n   130\n   131    // Find the last space within the width limit\n   132    var last_space: ?usize = null;\n   133    for (0..width) |i| {\n   134        if (text[i] == ' ') {\n   135            last_space = i;\n   136        }\n   137    }\n   138\n   139    // If we found a space, wrap there (include the space in this line)\n   140    if (last_space) |space_pos| {\n   141        // Return position including the space, so next line starts after it\n   142        return space_pos + 1;\n   143    }\n   144\n   145    // No space found - break at max width (hard wrap)\n   146    return width;\n   147}\n   148\n   149/// Calculate the display width of a string (counting grapheme columns).\n   150/// Simple implementation: counts codepoints, treating wide chars as width 2.\n   151fn textDisplayWidth(str: []const u8) u16 {\n   152    var width: u16 = 0;\n   153    var iter = std.unicode.Utf8View.initUnchecked(str).iterator();\n   154    while (iter.nextCodepoint()) |cp| {\n   155        width +|= if (isWideCodepoint(cp)) 2 else 1;\n   156    }\n   157    return width;\n   158}\n   159\n   160/// Check if a codepoint is a wide character (CJK, etc.)\n   161fn isWideCodepoint(cp: u21) bool {\n   162    return (cp >= 0x4E00 and cp <= 0x9FFF) or // CJK Unified Ideographs\n   163        (cp >= 0x3400 and cp <= 0x4DBF) or // CJK Extension A\n   164        (cp >= 0x20000 and cp <= 0x2A6DF) or // CJK Extension B\n   165        (cp >= 0xF900 and cp <= 0xFAFF) or // CJK Compatibility\n   166        (cp >= 0xFF00 and cp <= 0xFF60) or // Fullwidth forms\n   167        (cp >= 0xFFE0 and cp <= 0xFFE6) or // Fullwidth symbols\n   168        (cp >= 0x3000 and cp <= 0x303F) or // CJK Punctuation\n   169        (cp >= 0x1100 and cp <= Lines beyond the area height are not rendered.\npub const Paragraph = struct {\n    /// The text content to display\n    text: []const u8,\n\n    /// Style applied to the text\n    style: Style = Style.empty,\n\n    /// Text wrapping mode\n    wrap: Wrap = .none,\n\n    /// Text alignment within each line\n    alignment: Alignment = .left,\n\n    /// Render the paragraph into the buffer at the given area.\n    /// Text is split into lines (either by newlines or wrapping) and rendered\n    /// until the area height is filled.\n    pub fn render(self: Paragraph, area: Rect, buf: *Buffer) void {\n        if (area.isEmpty()) return;\n        if (self.text.len == 0) return;\n\n        var y = area.y;\n        const max_y = area.bottom();\n\n        // Process text line by line (split by newlines first)\n        var line_iter = std.mem.splitScalar(u8, self.text, '\\n');\n        while (line_iter.next()) |logical_line| {\n            if (y >= max_y) break;\n\n            // Apply wrapping to this logical line\n            switch (self.wrap) {\n                .none => {\n                    self.renderLine(logical_line, area.x, y, area.width, buf);\n                    y += 1;\n                },\n                .char => {\n                    var remaining = logical_line;\n                    while (remaining.len > 0 and y < max_y) {\n                        const chunk_len = @min(remaining.len, area.width);\n                        const chunk = remaining[0..chunk_len];\n                        self.renderLine(chunk, area.x, y, area.width, buf);\n                        remaining = remaining[chunk_len..];\n                        y += 1;\n                    }\n                    // Empty line should still take a row\n                    if (logical_line.len == 0) {\n                        y += 1;\n                    }\n                },\n                .word => {\n                    if (logical_line.len == 0) {\n                        y += 1;\n                        continue;\n                    }\n                    var line_start: usize = 0;\n                    while (line_start < logical_line.len and y < max_y) {\n                        const wrap_end = findWordWrapEnd(logical_line[line_start..], area.width);\n                        const line = logical_line[line_start .. line_start + wrap_end];\n                        self.renderLine(line, area.x, y, area.width, buf);\n                        line_start += wrap_end;\n                        // Skip leading spaces on next line\n                        while (line_start < logical_line.len and logical_line[line_start] == ' ') {\n                            line_start += 1;\n                        }\n                        y += 1;\n                    }\n                },\n            }\n        }\n    }\n\n    /// Render a single line of text with alignment\n    fn renderLine(self: Paragraph, line: []const u8, x: u16, y: u16, width: u16, buf: *Buffer) void {\n        if (line.len == 0) return;\n\n        const text_len = textDisplayWidth(line);\n        const visible_len = @min(text_len, width);\n\n        if (visible_len == 0) return;\n\n        const x_offset: u16 = switch (self.alignment) {\n            .left => 0,\n            .center => (width -| visible_len) / 2,\n            .right => width -| visible_len,\n        };\n\n        buf.setString(x +| x_offset, y, line, self.style);\n    }\n};\n\n/// Find the end index for word wrapping within a max width.\n/// Returns the number of characters to include on this line.\nfn findWordWrapEnd(text: []const u8, max_width: u16) usize {\n    if (text.len == 0) return 0;\n\n    const width: usize = @intCast(max_width);\n    if (text.len <= width) return text.len;\n\n    // Find the last space within the width limit\n    var last_space: ?usize = null;\n    for (0..width) |i| {\n        if (text[i] == ' ') {\n            last_space = i;\n        }\n    }\n\n    // If we found a space, wrap there (include the space in this line)\n    if (last_space) |space_pos| {\n        // Return position including the space, so next line starts after it\n        return space_pos + 1;\n    }\n\n    // No space found - break at max width (hard wrap)\n    return width;\n}\n\n/// Calculate the display width of a string (counting grapheme columns).\n/// Simple implementation: counts codepoints, treating wide chars as width 2.\nfn textDisplayWidth(str: []const u8) u16 {\n    var width: u16 = 0;\n    var iter = std.unicode.Utf8View.initUnchecked(str).iterator();\n    while (iter.nextCodepoint()) |cp| {\n        width +|= if (isWideCodepoint(cp)) 2 else 1;\n    }\n    return width;\n}\n\n/// Check if a codepoint is a wide character (CJK, etc.)\nfn isWideCodepoint(cp: u21) bool {\n    return (cp >= 0x4E00 and cp <= 0x9FFF) or // CJK Unified Ideographs\n        (cp >= 0x3400 and cp <= 0x4DBF) or // CJK Extension A\n        (cp >= 0x20000 and cp <= 0x2A6DF) or // CJK Extension B\n        (cp >= 0xF900 and cp <= 0xFAFF) or // CJK Compatibility\n        (cp >= 0xFF00 and cp <= 0xFF60) or // Fullwidth forms\n        (cp >= 0xFFE0 and cp <= 0xFFE6) or // Fullwidth symbols\n        (cp >= 0x3000 and cp <= 0x303F) or // CJK Punctuation\n        (cp >= 0x1100 and cp <= 0x11FF); // Hangul Jamo\n}\n\n// ============================================================\n// SANITY TESTS - Basic Paragraph functionality\n// ============================================================\n\ntest \"sanity: Paragraph with default values\" {\n    const para = Paragraph{ .text = \"Hello\\nWorld\" };\n    try std.testing.expectEqualStrings(\"Hello\\nWorld\", para.text);\n    try std.testing.expect(para.style.isEmpty());\n    try std.testing.expect(para.wrap == .none);\n    try std.testing.expect(para.alignment == .left);\n}\n\ntest \"sanity: Paragraph with custom style\" {\n    const para = Paragraph{\n        .text = \"Styled\",\n        .style = Style.init().bold().fg(.red),\n    };\n    try std.testing.expect(para.style.hasAttribute(.bold));\n}\n\ntest \"sanity: Paragraph with wrap modes\" {\n    const none_wrap = Paragraph{ .text = \"T\", .wrap = .none };\n    const char_wrap = Paragraph{ .text = \"T\", .wrap = .char };\n    const word_wrap = Paragraph{ .text = \"T\", .wrap = .word };\n\n    try std.testing.expect(none_wrap.wrap == .none);\n    try std.testing.expect(char_wrap.wrap == .char);\n    try std.testing.expect(word_wrap.wrap == .word);\n}\n\ntest \"sanity: Paragraph with alignment\" {\n    const left = Paragraph{ .text = \"L\", .alignment = .left };\n    const center = Paragraph{ .text = \"C\", .alignment = .center };\n    const right = Paragraph{ .text = \"R\", .alignment = .right };\n\n    try std.testing.expect(left.alignment == .left);\n    try std.testing.expect(center.alignment == .center);\n    try std.testing.expect(right.alignment == .right);\n}\n\n// ============================================================\n// BEHAVIOR TESTS - Rendering\n// ============================================================\n\ntest \"behavior: Paragraph renders single line\" {\n    var buf = try Buffer.init(std.testing.allocator, 20, 5);\n    defer buf.deinit();\n\n    const para = Paragraph{ .text = \"Hello\" };\n    para.render(Rect.init(0, 0, 20, 5), &buf);\n\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(@as(u21, 'H'), buf.get(0, 0).char);\n    try   try std.testing.expectEqual(@as(u21, 'o'), buf.get(4, 0).char);\n}\n\ntest \"behavior: Paragraph renders multiple lines with newlines\" {\n    var buf = try Buffer.init(std.testing.allocator, 20, 5);\n    defer buf.deinit();\n\n    const para = Paragraph{ .text = \"Line1\\nLine2\\nLine3\" };\n    para.render(Rect.init(0, 0, 20, 5), &buf);\n\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(@as(u21, 'L'), buf.get(0, 0).char);\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(@as(u21, '1'), buf.get(4, 0).char);\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(@as(u21, 'L'), buf.get(0, 1).char);\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(@as(u21, '2'), buf.get(4, 1).char);\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(@as(u21, 'L'), buf.get(0, 2).char);\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(@as(u21, '3'), buf.get(4, 2).char);\n}\n\ntest \"behavior: Paragraph std.testing.expectEqual(@as(u21, 'J'), buf.get(9, 0).char);\n    // Next 6 chars on row 1\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(@as(u21, 'K'), buf.get(0, 1).char);\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(@as(u21,      .text = \"Hello World Today\",\n        .wrap = .word,\n    };\n    para.render(Rect.init(0, 0, 10, 5), &buf);\n\n    // \"Hello \" should be on row 0\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(@as(u21, 1).char);\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(@as(u21, 'd'), buf.get(4, 1).char);\n    // \"Today\" should be on row 2\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(@as(u21, 'T'), buf.get(0, 2).char);\n}\n\ntest \"behavior: Paragraph center alignment\" {\n    var buf = try Buffer.init(std.testing.allocator, 20, 5);\n    defer buf.deinit();\n\n    const para = Paragraph{\n        .text = \"Hi\",\n        .alignment = .center,\n    };\n    para.render(Rect.init(0, 0, 20, 5), &buf);\n\n    // \"Hi\" (2 chars) centered in 20 = offset 9\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(@as(u21, 'H'), buf.get(9, 0).char);\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(@as(u21, 'i'), buf.get(10, 0).char);\n}\n\ntest \"behavior: Paragraph right alignment\" {\n    var buf = try Buffer.init(std.testing.allocator, 20, 5);\n    defer buf.deinit();\n\n    const para = Paragraph{\n        .text = \"End\",\n        .alignment = .right,\n    };\n    para.render(Rect.init(0, 0, 20, 5), &buf);\n\n    // \"End\" (3 chars)  }\n    75    }\n    76\n    77    /// Get the number of tabs\n    78    pub fn count(self: Tabs) usize {\n    79        return self.titles.len;\n    80    }\n    81\n    82    /// Check if tabs are Tabs widget for zithril TUI framework\n// Tab bar with titles, selection, and customizable divider\n\nconst std = @import(\"std\");\nconst buffer_mod = @import(\"../buffer.zig\");\nconst geometry = @import(\"../geometry.zig\");\nconst style_mod = @import(\"../style.zig\");\n\npub const Buffer = buffer_mod.Buffer;\npub const Cell = buffer_mod.Cell;\npub const Rect = geometry.Rect;\npub const Style = style_mod.Style;\n\n/// Tabs widget displaying a horizontal tab bar.\n///\n/// Renders a row of tab titles with the selected tab highlighted.\n/// Tabs are separated by a configurable divider string.\npub const Tabs = struct {\n    /// Tab titles to display\n    titles: []const []const u8,\n\n    /// Index of the currently selected tab\n    selected: usize = 0,\n\n    /// Default style for unselected tabs\n    style: Style = Style.empty,\n\n    /// Style for the selected tab\n    highlight_style: Style = Style.init().bold().fg(.yellow),\n\n    /// Divider string between tabs\n    divider: []const u8 = \" | \",\n\n    /// Render the tabs into the buffer at the given area.\n    /// Tabs are rendered horizontally on the first row of the area.\n    pub fn render(self: Tabs, area: Rect, buf: *Buffer) void {\n        if (area.isEmpty()) return;\n        if (self.titles.len == 0) return;\n\n        var x = area.x;\n\n        for (self.titles, 0..) |title, idx| {\n            if (x >= area.right()) break;\n\n            // Determine if this tab is selected\n            const is_selected = idx == self.selected;\n            const tab_style = if (is_selected) self.highlight_style else self.style;\n\n            // Render tab title\n            const available_width = area.right() -| x;\n            if (available_width == 0) break;\n\n            const title_len = textDisplayWidth(title);\n            const render_len = @min(title_len, available_width);\n\n            if (render_len > 0) {\n                buf.setString(x, area.y, title, tab_style);\n            }\n\n            x +|= @intCast(render_len);\n\n            // Render divider after tab (except for last tab)\n            if (idx + 1 < self.titles.len and x < area.right()) {\n                const divider_available = area.right() -| x;\n                const divider_len = textDisplayWidth(self.divider);\n                const divider_render_len = @min(divider_len, divider_available);\n\n                if (divider_render_len > 0) {\n                    buf.setString(x, area.y, self.divider, self.style);\n                }\n\n                x +|= @intCast(divider_render_len);\n            }\n        }\n    }\n\n    /// Get the number of tabs\n    pub fn count(self: Tabs) usize {\n        return self.titles.len;\n    }\n\n    /// Check if tabs are empty\n    pub fn isEmpty(self: Tabs) bool {\n        return self.titles.len == 0;\n    }\n\n    /// Get the selected tab index, clamped to valid range\n    pub fn selectedClamped(self: Tabs) ?usize {\n        if (self.titles.len == 0) return null;\n        return @min(self.selected, self.titles.len - 1);\n    }\n};\n\n/// Calculate the display width of a string.\nfn textDisplayWidth(str: []const u8) u16 {\n    var width: u16 = 0;\n    var iter = std.unicode.Utf8View.initUnchecked(str).iterator();\n    while (iter.nextCodepoint()) |cp| {\n        width +|= if (isWideCodepoint(cp)) 2 else 1;\n    }\n    return width;\n}\n\n/// Check if a codepoint is a wide character (CJK, etc.)\nfn isWideCodepoint(cp: u21) bool {\n    return (cp >= 0x4E00 and cp <= 0x9FFF) or\n        (cp >= 0x3400 and cp <= 0x4DBF) or\n        (cp >= 0x20000 and cp <= 0x2A6DF) or\n        (cp >= 0xF900 and cp <= 0xFAFF) or\n        (cp >= 0xFF00 and cp <= 0xFF60) or\n        (cp >= 0xFFE0 and cp <= 0xFFE6) or\n        (cp >= 0x3000 and cp <= 0x303F) or\n        (cp >= 0x1100 and cp <= 0x11FF);\n}\n\n// ============================================================\n// SANITY TESTS - Basic Tabs buffer diff.\n    14/// Used for incremental rendering - only changed cells are output.\n    15pub const CellUpdate = struct {\n    16    x: u16,\n    17    y: u16,\n    18    cell: Cell,\n    19};\n    20\n    21/// Buffer is a 2D grid of Cells representing the terminal screen.\n    22/// Cells are stored in row-major order: cells[y * width + x].\n    23/// Widgets render into the Buffer, which is then diffed and output to the terminal.\n    24pub const Buffer = struct {\n    25    /// Width in terminal columns.\n    26    width: u16,\n    27    /// Height in terminal rows.\n    28    height: u16,\n    29    /// Cell storage in row-major order.\n    30    cells: []Cell,\n    31    /// Allocator used for cell storage.\n    32    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n    33\n    34    /// Initialize a buffer with the given dimensions.\n    35    /// All cells are initialized to the default (space with empty style).\n    36    pub fn init(allocator: std.mem.Allocator, width: u16, height: u16) !Buffer {\n    37        const size = @as(usize, width) * @as(usize, height);\n    38        const cells = try allocator.alloc(Cell, size);\n    39        @memset(cells, Cell.default);\n    40\n    41        return Buffer{\n    42            .width = width,\n    43            .height = height,\n    44            .cells = cells,\n    45            .allocator = allocator,\n    46        };\n    47    }\n    48\n    49    /// Free the cell storage.\n    50    pub fn deinit(self: *Buffer) void {\n    51        self.allocator.free(self.cells);\n    52        self.* = undefined;\n    53    }\n    54\n    55    /// Reset all cells to default.\n    56    pub fn clear(self: *Buffer) void {\n    57        @memset(self.cells, Cell.default);\n    58    }\n    59\n    60    /// Calculate the index for a given (x, y) position.\n    61    /// Returns null if out of bounds.\n    62    fn index(self: Buffer, x: u16, y: u16) ?usize {\n    63        if (x >= self.width or y >= self.height) {\n self.cells[idx] = cell;\n    74        }\n    75    }\n    76\n    77    /// Get a cell at position (x, y).\n    78    /// Returns the default cell if out of bounds.\n    79    pub fn get(self:    /// Write a string starting at (x, y) with the given style.\n    87    /// Handles wide characters (width 2) by filling the next cell with a placeholder.\n    88    /// Clips at buffer bounds.\n    89    pub fn setString(self: *Buffer, x: u16, y: u16, str: []const u8, style: Style) void {\n    90        if (y >= self.height) return;\n    91\n    92        var current_x = x;\n    93        var Buffer type for zithril TUI framework\n// A 2D grid of Cells that widgets render into\n\nconst std = @import(\"std\");\nconst cell_mod = @import(\"cell.zig\");\nconst geometry = @import(\"geometry.zig\");\nconst style_mod = @import(\"style.zig\");\n\npub const Cell = cell_mod.Cell;\npub const Rect = geometry.Rect;\npub const Style = style_mod.Style;\n\n/// A single cell change in a buffer diff.\n/// Used for incremental rendering - only changed cells are output.\npub const CellUpdate = struct {\n    x: u16,\n    y: u16,\n    cell: Cell,\n};\n\n/// Buffer is a 2D grid of Cells representing the terminal screen.\n/// Cells are stored in row-major order: cells[y * width + x].\n/// Widgets render into the Buffer, which is then diffed and output to the terminal.\npub const Buffer = struct {\n    /// Width in terminal columns.\n    width: u16,\n    /// Height in terminal rows.\n    height: u16,\n    /// Cell storage in row-major order.\n    cells: []Cell,\n    /// Allocator used for cell storage.\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n\n    /// Initialize a buffer with the given dimensions.\n    /// All cells are initialized to the default (space with empty style).\n    pub fn init(allocator: std.mem.Allocator, width: u16, height: u16) !Buffer {\n        const size = @as(usize, width) * @as(usize, height);\n        const cells = try allocator.alloc(Cell, size);\n        @memset(cells, Cell.default);\n\n        return Buffer{\n            .width = width,\n            .height = height,\n            .cells = cells,\n            .allocator = allocator,\n        };\n    }\n\n    /// Free the cell storage.\n    pub fn deinit(self: *Buffer) void {\n        self.allocator.free(self.cells);\n        self.* = undefined;\n    }\n\n    /// Reset all cells to default.\n    pub fn clear(self: *Buffer) void {\n        @memset(self.cells, Cell.default);\n    }\n\n    /// Calculate the index for a given (x, y) position.\n    /// Returns null if out of bounds.\n    fn index(self: Buffer, x: u16, y: u16) ?usize {\n        if (x >= self.width or y >= self.height) {\n            return null;\n        }\n        return @as(usize, y) * @as(usize, self.width) + @as(usize, x);\n    }\n\n    /// Set a single cell at position (x, y).\n    /// Does nothing if position is out of bounds.\n    pub fn set(self: *Buffer, x: u16, y: u16, cell: Cell) void {\n        if (self.index(x, y)) |idx| {\n            self.cells[idx] = cell;\n        }\n    }\n\n    /// Get a cell at position (x, y).\n    /// Returns the default cell if out of bounds.\n    pub fn get(self: Buffer, x: u16, y: u16) Cell {\n        if (self.index(x, y)) |idx| {\n            return self.cells[idx];\n        }\n        return Cell.default;\n    }\n\n    /// Write a string starting at (x, y) with the given style.\n    /// Handles wide characters (width 2) by filling the next cell with a placeholder.\n    /// Clips at buffer bounds.\n    pub fn setString(self: *Buffer, x: u16, y: u16, str: []const u8, style: Style) void {\n        if (y >= self.height) return;\n\n        var current_x = x;\n        var iter = std.unicode.Utf8View.initUnchecked(str).iterator();\n\n        while (iter.nextCodepoint()) |codepoint| {\n            if (current_x >= self.width) break;\n\n            const cell = Cell.styled(codepoint, style);\n            self.set(current_x, y, cell);\n\n            // Handle wide characters\n            if (cell.isWide()) {\n                current_x +|= 1;\n                if (current_x < self.width) {\n                    // Place a placeholder in the following cell for wide chars\n                    self.set(current_x, y, Cell.withWidth(' ', style, 0));\n                }\n            }\n\n            current_x +|= 1;\n        }\n    }\n\n    /// Fill a rectangular region with a cell.\n    /// Clips to buffer bounds.\n    pub fn fill(self: *Buffer, rect: Rect, cell: Cell) void {\n        const start_x = rect.x;\n        const start_y = rect.y;\n        const end_x = @min(rect.right(), self.width);\n        const end_y = @min(rect.bottom(), self.height);\n\n        if (start_x >= self.width or start_y >= self.height) return;\n\n        var y = start_y;\n        while (y < end_y) : (y += 1) {\n            var curr_x = start_x;\n            while (curr_x < end_x) : (curr_x += 1) {\n                self.set(curr_x, y, cell);\n            }\n        }\n    }\n\n    /// Fill a rectangular region with a style (preserves characters).\n    /// Clips to buffer bounds.\n    pub fn setStyleArea(self: *Buffer, rect: Rect, style: Style) void {\n        const start_x = rect.x;\n        const start_y = rect.y;\n        const end_x = @min(rect.right(), self.width);\n        const end_y = @min(rect.bottom(), self.height);\n\n        if (start_x >= self.width or start_y >= self.height) return;\n\n        var y = start_y;\n        while (y < end_y) : (y += 1) {\n            var curr_x = start_x;\n            while (curr_x < end_x) : (curr_x += 1) {\n                if (self.index(curr_x, y)) |idx| {\n                    self.cells[idx] = self.cells[idx].setStyle(style);\n                }\n            }\n        }\n    }\n\n    /// Get the total number of cells.\n    pub fn cellCount(self: Buffer) usize {\n        return @as(usize, self.width) * @as(usize, self.height);\n    }\n\n    /// Returns the buffer as a Rect covering the entire area.\n    pub fn area(self: Buffer) Rect {\n        return Rect.init(0, 0, self.width, self.height);\n    }\n\n    /// Resize the buffer. Existing content is lost.\n    pub fn resize(self: *Buffer, new_width: u16, new_height: u16) !void {\n        const new_size = @as(usize, new_width) * @as(usize, new_height);\n\n        if (new_size != self.cellCount()) {\n            self.allocator.free(self.cells);\n            self.cells = try self.allocator.alloc(Cell, new_size);\n        }\n\n        self.width = new_width;\n        self.height = new_height;\n        @memset(self.cells, Cell.default);\n    }\n\n    /// Compute diff between this buffer and another buffer.\n    /// Returns a slice of CellUpdates representing cells that differ.\n    /// The updates array must be provided by the caller and should have\n    /// capacity for at least cellCount() elements in the worst case.\n    /// Only compares cells within the overlapping region of both buffers.\n    /// Unchanged cells are skipped for minimal output.\n    pub fn diff(self: Buffer, other: Buffer, updates: []CellUpdate) []CellUpdate {\n        const compare_width = @min(self.width, other.width);\n        const compare_height = @min(self.height, other.height);\n\n        var update_count: usize = 0;\n\n        var y: u16 = 0;\n        while (y < compare_height) : (y += 1) {\n            var x: u16 = 0;\n            while (x < compare_width) : (x += 1) {\n                const self_cell = self.get(x, y);\n                const other_cell = other.get(x, y);\n\n                if (!self_cell.eql(other_cell)) {\n                    if (update_count < updates.len) {\n                        updates[update_count] = .{\n                            .x = x,\n                            .y = y,\n                            .cell = self_cell,\n                        };\n                        update_count += 1;\n                    }\n                }\n            }\n        }\n\n        return updates[0..update_count];\n    }\n\n    /// Compute diff and return the number of changed cells.\n    /// Useful for determining if any changes 1) {\n                const self_cell = self.get(x, y);\n                const other_cell = other.get(x, y);\n\n                if (!self_cell.eql(other_cell)) {\n                    count += 1;\n {"type":"assistant","message":{"model":"claude-opus-4-5-20251101","id":"msg_01V4X6uimXFiMYpzN58EimVw","type":"message","role":"assistant","content":[{"type":"tool_use","id":"toolu_0153nEjUsJoKJvvhbv5zGHni","name":"Write","input":{"file_path":"/home/hotschmoe/zithril/src/text.zig","content":"// Text utilities for zithril TUI framework\n// Shared functions for text display width calculation\n\nconst std = @import(\"std\");\nconst cell_mod = @import(\"cell.zig\");\n\n/// Calculate the display width of a string in terminal columns.\n/// Uses rich_zig's character width calculation for accuracy with CJK,\n/// emoji, and other wide characters.\npub fn displayWidth(str: []const u8) u16 {\n    var width: u16 = 0;\n    var iter = std.unicode.Utf8View.initUnchecked(str).iterator();\n    while (iter.nextCodepoint()) |cp| {\n        width +|= cell_mod.Cell.charWidth(cp);\n    }\n    return width;\n}\n\n// ============================================================\n// TESTS\n// ============================================================\n\ntest \"displayWidth: ASCII string\" {\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(@as(u16, 5), displayWidth(\"Hello\"));\n}\n\ntest \"displayWidth: empty string\" {\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(@as(u16, 0), displayWidth(\"\"));\n}\n\ntest \"displayWidth: CJK character\" {\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(@as(u16, 2), displayWidth(\"\\u{4E2D}\"));\n}\n\ntest \"displayWidth: mixed ASCII and CJK\" {\n    // \"Hi\" (2) + CJK (2) = 4\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(@as(u16, 4), displayWidth(\"Hi\\u{4E2D}\"));\n}\n"}}],"stop_reason":null,"stop_sequence":null,"usage":{"input_tokens":0,"cache_creation_input_tokens":446,"cache_read_input_tokens":82064,"cache_creation":{"ephemeral_5m_input_tokens":0,"ephemeral_1h_input_tokens":446},"output_tokens":25,"service_tier":"standard"},"context_management":null},"parent_tool_use_id":null,"session_id":"a298eb2e-01ab-48ce-a181-2fc255d1a03c","uuid":"f3a75b78-5895-4a58-877e-745a40761f21"}

Lines beyond the area height are not rendered.\npub const Paragraph = struct {\n    /// The text content to display\n    text: []const u8,\n\n    /// Style applied to the text\n    style: Style = Style.empty,\n\n    /// Text wrapping mode\n    wrap: Wrap = .none,\n\n    /// Text alignment within each line\n    alignment: Alignment = .left,\n\n    /// Render the paragraph into the buffer at the given area.\n    /// Text is split into lines (either by newlines or wrapping) and rendered\n    /// until the area height is filled.\n    pub fn render(self: Paragraph, area: Rect, buf: *Buffer) void {\n        if (area.isEmpty()) return;\n        if (self.text.len == 0) return;\n\n        var y = area.y;\n        const max_y = area.bottom();\n\n        // Process text line by line (split by newlines first)\n        var line_iter = std.mem.splitScalar(u8, self.text, '\\n');\n        while (line_iter.next()) |logical_line| {\n            if (y >= max_y) break;\n\n            // Apply wrapping to this logical line\n            switch (self.wrap) {\n                .none => {\n                    self.renderLine(logical_line, area.x, y, area.width, buf);\n                    y += 1;\n                },\n                .char => {\n                    var remaining = logical_line;\n                    while (remaining.len > 0 and y < max_y) {\n                        const chunk_len = @min(remaining.len, area.width);\n                        const chunk = remaining[0..chunk_len];\n                        self.renderLine(chunk, area.x, y, area.width, buf);\n                        remaining = remaining[chunk_len..];\n                        y += 1;\n                    }\n                    // Empty line should still take a row\n                    if (logical_line.len == 0) {\n                        y += 1;\n                    }\n                },\n                .word => {\n                    if (logical_line.len == 0) {\n                        y += 1;\n                        continue;\n                    }\n                    var line_start: usize = 0;\n                    while (line_start < logical_line.len and y < max_y) {\n                        const wrap_end = findWordWrapEnd(logical_line[line_start..], area.width);\n                        const line = logical_line[line_start .. line_start + wrap_end];\n                        self.renderLine(line, area.x, y, area.width, buf);\n                        line_start += wrap_end;\n                        // Skip leading spaces on next line\n                        while (line_start < logical_line.len and logical_line[line_start] == ' ') {\n                            line_start += 1;\n                        }\n                        y += 1;\n                    }\n                },\n            }\n        }\n    }\n\n    /// Render a single line of text with alignment\n    fn renderLine(self: Paragraph, line: []const u8, x: u16, y: u16, width: u16, buf: *Buffer) void {\n        if (line.len == 0) return;\n\n        const text_len = textDisplayWidth(line);\n        const visible_len = @min(text_len, width);\n\n        if (visible_len == 0) return;\n\n        const x_offset: u16 = switch (self.alignment) {\n            .left => 0,\n            .center => (width -| visible_len) / 2,\n            .right => width -| visible_len,\n        };\n\n        buf.setString(x +| x_offset, y, line, self.style);\n    }\n};\n\n/// Find the end index for word wrapping within a max width.\n/// Returns the number of characters to include on this line.\nfn findWordWrapEnd(text: []const u8, max_width: u16) usize {\n    if (text.len == 0) return 0;\n\n    const width: usize = @intCast(max_width);\n    if (text.len <= width) return text.len;\n\n    // Find the last space within the width limit\n    var last_space: ?usize = null;\n    for (0..width) |i| {\n        if (text[i] == ' ') {\n            last_space = i;\n        }\n    }\n\n    // If we found a space, wrap there (include the space in this line)\n    if (last_space) |space_pos| {\n        // Return position including the space, so next line starts after it\n        return space_pos + 1;\n    }\n\n    // No space found - break at max width (hard wrap)\n    return width;\n}\n\n/// Calculate the display width of a string (counting grapheme columns).\n/// Simple implementation: counts codepoints, treating wide chars as width 2.\nfn textDisplayWidth(str: []const u8) u16 {\n    var width: u16 = 0;\n    var iter = std.unicode.Utf8View.initUnchecked(str).iterator();\n    while (iter.nextCodepoint()) |cp| {\n        width +|= if (isWideCodepoint(cp)) 2 else 1;\n    }\n    return width;\n}\n\n/// Check if a codepoint is a wide character (CJK, etc.)\nfn isWideCodepoint(cp: u21) bool {\n    return (cp >= 0x4E00 and cp <= 0x9FFF) or // CJK Unified Ideographs\n        (cp >= 0x3400 and cp <= 0x4DBF) or // CJK Extension A\n        (cp >= 0x20000 and cp <= 0x2A6DF) or // CJK Extension B\n        (cp >= 0xF900 and cp <= 0xFAFF) or // CJK Compatibility\n        (cp >= 0xFF00 and cp <= 0xFF60) or // Fullwidth forms\n        (cp >= 0xFFE0 and cp <= 0xFFE6) or // Fullwidth symbols\n        (cp >= 0x3000 and cp <= 0x303F) or // CJK Punctuation\n        (cp >= 0x1100 and cp <= 0x11FF); // Hangul Jamo\n}\n\n// ============================================================\n// SANITY TESTS - Basic Paragraph functionality\n// ============================================================\n\ntest \"sanity: Paragraph with default values\" {\n    const para = Paragraph{ .text = \"Hello\\nWorld\" };\n    try std.testing.expectEqualStrings(\"Hello\\nWorld\", para.text);\n    try std.testing.expect(para.style.isEmpty());\n    try std.testing.expect(para.wrap == .none);\n    try std.testing.expect(para.alignment == .left);\n}\n\ntest \"sanity: Paragraph with custom style\" {\n    const para = Paragraph{\n        .text = \"Styled\",\n        .style = Style.init().bold().fg(.red),\n    };\n    try std.testing.expect(para.style.hasAttribute(.bold));\n}\n\ntest \"sanity: Paragraph with wrap modes\" {\n    const none_wrap = Paragraph{ .text = \"T\", .wrap = .none };\n    const char_wrap = Paragraph{ .text = \"T\", .wrap = .char };\n    const word_wrap = Paragraph{ .text = \"T\", .wrap = .word };\n\n    try std.testing.expect(none_wrap.wrap == .none);\n    try std.testing.expect(char_wrap.wrap == .char);\n    try std.testing.expect(word_wrap.wrap == .word);\n}\n\ntest \"sanity: Paragraph with alignment\" {\n    const left = Paragraph{ .text = \"L\", .alignment = .left };\n    const center = Paragraph{ .text = \"C\", .alignment = .center };\n    const right = Paragraph{ .text = \"R\", .alignment = .right };\n\n    try std.testing.expect(left.alignment == .left);\n    try std.testing.expect(center.alignment == .center);\n    try std.testing.expect(right.alignment == .right);\n}\n\n// ============================================================\n// BEHAVIOR TESTS - Rendering\n// ============================================================\n\ntest \"behavior: Paragraph renders single line\" {\n    var buf = try Buffer.init(std.testing.allocator, 20, 5);\n    defer buf.deinit();\n\n    const para = Paragraph{ .text = \"Hello\" };\n    para.render(Rect.init(0, 0, 20, 5), &buf);\n\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(@as(u21, 'H'), buf.get(0, 0).char);\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(@as(u21, 'e'), buf.get(1, 0).char);\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(@as(u21, 'l'), buf.get(2, 0).char);\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(@as(u21, 'l'), buf.get(3, 0).char);\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(@as(u21, 'o'), buf.get(4, 0).char);\n}\n\ntest \"behavior: Paragraph renders multiple lines with newlines\" {\n    var buf = try Buffer.init(std.testing.allocator, 20, 5);\n    defer buf.deinit();\n\n    const para = Paragraph{ .text = \"Line1\\nLine2\\nLine3\" };\n    para.render(Rect.init(0, 0, 20, 5), &buf);\n\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(@as(u21, 'L'), buf.get(0, 0).char);\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(@as(u21, '1'), buf.get(4, 0).char);\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(@as(u21, 'L'), buf.get(0, 1).char);\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(@as(u21, '2'), buf.get(4, 1).char);\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(@as(u21, 'L'), buf.get(0, 2).char);\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(@as(u21, '3'), buf.get(4, 2).char);\n}\n\ntest \"behavior: Paragraph with char wrap\" {\n    var buf = try Buffer.init(std.testing.allocator, 10, 5);\n    defer buf.deinit();\n\n    const para = Paragraph{\n        .text = \"ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOP\",\n        .wrap = .char,\n    };\n    para.render(Rect.init(0, 0, 10, 5), &buf);\n\n    // First 10 chars on row 0\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(@as(u21, 'A'), buf.get(0, 0).char);\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(@as(u21, 'J'), buf.get(9, 0).char);\n    // Next 6 chars on row 1\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(@as(u21, 'K'), buf.get(0, 1).char);\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(@as(u21, 'P'), buf.get(5, 1).char);\n}\n\ntest \"behavior: Paragraph with word wrap\" {\n    var buf = try Buffer.init(std.testing.allocator, 10, 5);\n    defer buf.deinit();\n\n    const para = Paragraph{\n        .text = \"Hello World Today\",\n        .wrap = .word,\n    };\n    para.render(Rect.init(0, 0, 10, 5), &buf);\n\n    // \"Hello \" should be on row 0\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(@as(u21, 'H'), buf.get(0, 0).char);\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(@as(u21, 'o'), buf.get(4, 0).char);\n    // \"World \" should be on row 1\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(@as(u21, 'W'), buf.get(0, 1).char);\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(@as(u21, 'd'), buf.get(4, 1).char);\n    // \"Today\" should be on row 2\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(@as(u21, 'T'), buf.get(0, 2).char);\n}\n\ntest buffer_mod.Buffer;\npub const Rect = geometry.Rect;\npub const Style = style_mod.Style;\n\n/// Text wrapping modes\npub const Wrap = enum {\n    /// No wrapping, clip at boundary\n    none,\n    /// Wrap at any character position\n    char,\n    /// Wrap at word boundaries (spaces)\n    word,\n};\n\n/// Text alignment options\npub const Alignment = enum {\n    left,\n    center,\n    right,\n};\n\n/// Multi-line text widget with optional wrapping.\n///\n/// Renders text content across multiple lines with configurable wrapping\n/// behavior and alignment. Lines beyond the area height are not rendered.\npub const Paragraph = struct {\n    /// The text content to display\n    text: []const u8,\n\n    /// Style applied to the text\n    style: Style = Style.empty,\n\n    /// Text wrapping mode\n    wrap: Wrap = .none,\n\n    /// Text alignment within each line\n    alignment: Alignment = .left,\n\n    /// Render the paragraph into the buffer at the given area.\n    /// Text is split into lines (either by newlines or wrapping) and rendered\n    /// until the area height is filled.\n    pub fn render(self: Paragraph, area: Rect, buf: *Buffer) void {\n        if (area.isEmpty()) return;\n        if (self.text.len == 0) return;\n\n        var y = area.y;\n        const max_y = area.bottom();\n\n        // Process text line by line (split by newlines first)\n        var line_iter = std.mem.splitScalar(u8, self.text, '\\n');\n        while (line_iter.next()) |logical_line| {\n            if (y >= max_y) break;\n\n            // Apply wrapping to this logical line\n            switch (self.wrap) {\n                .none => {\n                    self.renderLine(logical_line, area.x, y, area.width, buf);\n                    y += 1;\n                },\n                .char => {\n                    var remaining = logical_line;\n                    while (remaining.len > 0 and y < max_y) {\n                        const chunk_len = @min(remaining.len, area.width);\n                        const chunk = remaining[0..chunk_len];\n                        self.renderLine(chunk, area.x, y, area.width, buf);\n                        remaining = remaining[chunk_len..];\n                        y += 1;\n                    }\n                    // Empty line should still take a row\n                    if (logical_line.len == 0) {\n                        y += 1;\n                    }\n                },\n                .word => {\n                    if (logical_line.len == 0) {\n                        y += 1;\n                        continue;\n                    }\n                    var line_start: usize = 0;\n                    while (line_start < logical_line.len and y < max_y) {\n                        const wrap_end = findWordWrapEnd(logical_line[line_start..], area.width);\n                        const line = logical_line[line_start .. line_start + wrap_end];\n                        self.renderLine(line, area.x, y, area.width, buf);\n                        line_start += wrap_end;\n                        // Skip leading spaces on next line\n                        while (line_start < logical_line.len and logical_line[line_start] == ' ') {\n                            line_start += 1;\n                        }\n                        y += 1;\n                    }\n                },\n            }\n        }\n    }\n\n    /// Render a single line of text with alignment\n    fn renderLine(self: Paragraph, line: []const u8, x: u16, y: u16, width: u16, buf: *Buffer) void {\n        if (line.len == 0) return;\n\n        const text_len = textDisplayWidth(line);\n        const visible_len = @min(text_len, width);\n\n        if (visible_len == 0) return;\n\n        const x_offset: u16 = switch (self.alignment) {\n            .left => 0,\n            .center => (width -| visible_len) / 2,\n            .right => width -| visible_len,\n        };\n\n        buf.setString(x +| x_offset, y, line, self.style);\n    }\n};\n\n/// Find the end index for word wrapping within a max width.\n/// Returns the number of characters to include on this line.\nfn findWordWrapEnd(text: []const u8, max_width: u16) usize {\n    if (text.len == 0) return 0;\n\n    const width: usize = @intCast(max_width);\n    if (text.len <= width) return text.len;\n\n    // Find the last space within the width limit\n    var last_space: ?usize = null;\n    for (0..width) |i| {\n        if (text[i] == ' ') {\n            last_space = i;\n        }\n    }\n\n    // If we found a space, wrap there (include the space in this line)\n    if (last_space) |space_pos| {\n        // Return position including the space, so next line starts after it\n        return space_pos + 1;\n    }\n\n    // No space found - break at max width (hard wrap)\n    return width;\n}\n\n/// Calculate the display width of a string (counting grapheme columns).\n/// Simple implementation: counts codepoints, treating wide chars as width 2.\nfn textDisplayWidth(str: []const u8) u16 {\n    var width: u16 = 0;\n    var iter = std.unicode.Utf8View.initUnchecked(str).iterator();\n    while (iter.nextCodepoint()) |cp| {\n        width +|= if (isWideCodepoint(cp)) 2 else 1;\n    }\n    return width;\n}\n\n/// Check if a codepoint is a wide character (CJK, etc.)\nfn isWideCodepoint(cp: u21) bool {\n    return (cp >= 0x4E00 and cp <= 0x9FFF) or // CJK Unified Ideographs\n        (cp >= 0x3400 and cp <= 0x4DBF) or // CJK Extension A\n        (cp >= 0x20000 and cp <= 0x2A6DF) or // CJK // Hangul Jamo\n}","newString":"","originalFile":"// Paragraph widget for zithril TUI framework\n// Multi-line text with wrapping and alignment\n\nconst std = @import(\"std\");\nconst buffer_mod = @import(\"../buffer.zig\");\nconst geometry = @import(\"../geometry.zig\");\nconst style_mod = @import(\"../style.zig\");\nconst text_mod = @import(\"../text.zig\");\n\npub const Buffer = buffer_mod.Buffer;\npub const Rect = geometry.Rect;\npub const Style = style_mod.Style;\n\n/// Text wrapping modes\npub const Wrap = enum {\n    /// No wrapping, clip at boundary\n    none,\n    /// Wrap at any character position\n    char,\n    /// Wrap at word boundaries (spaces)\n    word,\n};\n\n/// Text alignment options\npub const Alignment = enum {\n    left,\n    center,\n    right,\n};\n\n/// Multi-line text widget with optional wrapping.\n///\n/// Renders text content across multiple lines with configurable wrapping\n/// behavior and alignment. Lines beyond the area height are not rendered.\npub const Paragraph = struct {\n    /// The text content to display\n    text: []const u8,\n\n    /// Style applied to the text\n    style: Style = Style.empty,\n\n    /// Text wrapping mode\n    wrap: Wrap = .none,\n\n    /// Text alignment within each line\n    alignment: Alignment = .left,\n\n    /// Render the paragraph into the buffer at the given area.\n    /// Text is split into lines (either by newlines or wrapping) and rendered\n    /// until the area height is filled.\n    pub fn render(self: Paragraph, area: Rect, buf: *Buffer) void {\n        if (area.isEmpty()) return;\n        if (self.text.len == 0) return;\n\n        var y = area.y;\n        const max_y = area.bottom();\n\n        // Process text line by line (split by newlines first)\n        var line_iter = std.mem.splitScalar(u8, self.text, '\\n');\n        while (line_iter.next()) |logical_line| {\n            if (y >= max_y) break;\n\n            // Apply wrapping to this logical line\n            switch (self.wrap) {\n                .none => {\n                    self.renderLine(logical_line, area.x, y, area.width, buf);\n                    y += 1;\n                },\n                .char => {\n                    var remaining = logical_line;\n                    while (remaining.len > 0 and y < max_y) {\n                        const chunk_len = @min(remaining.len, area.width);\n                        const chunk = remaining[0..chunk_len];\n                        self.renderLine(chunk, area.x, y, area.width, buf);\n                        remaining = remaining[chunk_len..];\n                        y += 1;\n                    }\n                    // Empty line should still take a row\n                    if (logical_line.len == 0) {\n                        y += 1;\n                    }\n                },\n                .word => {\n                    if (logical_line.len == 0) {\n                        y += 1;\n                        continue;\n                    }\n                    var line_start: usize = 0;\n                    while (line_start < logical_line.len and y < max_y) {\n                        const wrap_end = findWordWrapEnd(logical_line[line_start..], area.width);\n                        const line = logical_line[line_start .. line_start + wrap_end];\n                        self.renderLine(line, area.x, y, area.width, buf);\n                        line_start += wrap_end;\n                        // Skip leading spaces on next line\n                        while (line_start < logical_line.len and logical_line[line_start] == ' ') {\n                            line_start += 1;\n                        }\n                        y += 1;\n                    }\n                },\n            }\n        }\n    }\n\n    /// Render a single line of text with alignment\n    fn renderLine(self: Paragraph, line: []const u8, x: u16, y: u16, width: u16, buf: *Buffer) void {\n        if (line.len == 0) return;\n\n        const text_len = text_mod.displayWidth(line);\n        const visible_len = @min(text_len, width);\n\n        if (visible_len == 0) return;\n\n        const x_offset: u16 = switch (self.alignment) {\n            .left => 0,\n            .center => (width -| visible_len) / 2,\n            .right => width -| visible_len,\n        };\n\n        buf.setString(x +| x_offset, y, line, self.style);\n    }\n};\n\n/// Find the end index for word wrapping within a max width.\n/// Returns the number of characters to include on this line.\nfn findWordWrapEnd(text: []const u8, max_width: u16) usize {\n    if (text.len == 0) return 0;\n\n    const width: usize = @intCast(max_width);\n    if (text.len <= width) return text.len;\n\n    // Find the last space within the width limit\n    var last_space: ?usize = null;\n    for (0..width) |i| {\n        if (text[i] == ' ') {\n            last_space = i;\n        }\n    }\n\n    // If we found a space, wrap there (include the space in this line)\n    if (last_space) |space_pos| {\n        // Return position including the space, so next line starts after it\n        return space_pos + 1;\n    }\n\n    // No space found - break at max width (hard wrap)\n    return width;\n}\n\n/// Calculate the display width of a string (counting grapheme columns).\n/// Simple implementation: counts codepoints, treating wide chars as width 2.\nfn textDisplayWidth(str: []const u8) u16 {\n    var width: u16 = 0;\n    var iter = std.unicode.Utf8View.initUnchecked(str).iterator();\n    while (iter.nextCodepoint()) |cp| {\n        width +|= if (isWideCodepoint(cp)) 2 else 1;\n    }\n    return width;\n}\n\n/// Check if a codepoint is a wide character (CJK, etc.)\nfn isWideCodepoint(cp: u21) bool {\n    return (cp >= 0x4E00 and cp <= 0x9FFF) or // CJK Unified Ideographs\n        (cp >= 0x3400 and cp <= 0x4DBF) or // CJK Extension A\n        (cp >= 0x20000 and cp <= 0x2A6DF) or // CJK Extension B\n        (cp >= 0xF900 and cp <= 0xFAFF) or // CJK Compatibility\n        (cp >= 0xFF00 and cp <= 0xFF60) or // Fullwidth forms\n        (cp >= 0xFFE0 and cp <= 0xFFE6) or // Fullwidth symbols\n        (cp >= 0x3000 and cp <= 0x303F) or // CJK Punctuation\n        (cp >= 0x1100 and cp <= 0x11FF); // Hangul Jamo\n}\n\n// ============================================================\n// SANITY TESTS - Basic Paragraph functionality\n// ============================================================\n\ntest \"sanity: Paragraph with default values\" {\n    const para = Paragraph{ .text = \"Hello\\nWorld\" };\n    try std.testing.expectEqualStrings(\"Hello\\nWorld\", para.text);\n    try std.testing.expect(para.style.isEmpty());\n    try std.testing.expect(para.wrap == .none);\n    try std.testing.expect(para.alignment == .left);\n}\n\ntest \"sanity: Paragraph with custom style\" {\n    const para = Paragraph{\n        .text = \"Styled\",\n        .style = Style.init().bold().fg(.red),\n    };\n    try std.testing.expect(para.style.hasAttribute(.bold));\n}\n\ntest \"sanity: {"type":"user","message":{"role":"user","content":[{"tool_use_id":"toolu_01HETQs5VEA8jwKSQcJMKSWY","type":"tool_result","content":"The file /home/hotschmoe/zithril/src/widgets/paragraph.zig has been updated successfully."}]},"parent_tool_use_id":null,"session_id":"a298eb2e-01ab-48ce-a181-2fc255d1a03c","uuid":"ba4fafc3-5020-4ed5-b9b8-a5e6f439815a","tool_use_result":{"filePath":"/home/hotschmoe/zithril/src/widgets/paragraph.zig","oldString":"test \"regression: textDisplayWidth handles ASCII\" {\n    const w = textDisplayWidth(\"Hello\");\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(@as(u16, 5), w);\n}\n\ntest \"regression: textDisplayWidth handles wide chars\" {\n    const w = textDisplayWidth(\"\\u{4E2D}\");\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(@as(u16, 2), w);\n}","newString":"","originalFile":"// Paragraph widget for zithril TUI framework\n// Multi-line text with wrapping and alignment\n\nconst std = @import(\"std\");\nconst buffer_mod = @import(\"../buffer.zig\");\nconst geometry = @import(\"../geometry.zig\");\nconst style_mod = @import(\"../style.zig\");\nconst text_mod = @import(\"../text.zig\");\n\npub const Buffer = buffer_mod.Buffer;\npub const Rect = geometry.Rect;\npub const Style = style_mod.Style;\n\n/// Text wrapping modes\npub const Wrap = enum {\n    /// No wrapping, clip at boundary\n    none,\n    /// Wrap at any character position\n    char,\n    /// Wrap at word boundaries (spaces)\n    word,\n};\n\n/// Text alignment options\npub const Alignment = enum {\n    left,\n    center,\n    right,\n};\n\n/// Multi-line text widget with optional wrapping.\n///\n/// Renders text content across multiple lines with configurable wrapping\n/// behavior and alignment. Lines beyond the area height are not rendered.\npub const Paragraph = struct {\n    /// The text content to display\n    text: []const u8,\n\n    /// Style applied to the text\n    style: Style = Style.empty,\n\n    /// Text wrapping mode\n    wrap: Wrap = .none,\n\n    /// Text alignment within each line\n    alignment: Alignment = .left,\n\n    /// Render the paragraph into the buffer at the given area.\n    /// Text is split into lines (either by newlines or wrapping) and rendered\n    /// until the area height is filled.\n    pub fn render(self: Paragraph, area: Rect, buf: *Buffer) void {\n        if (area.isEmpty()) return;\n        if (self.text.len == 0) return;\n\n        var y = area.y;\n        const max_y = area.bottom();\n\n        // Process text line by line (split by newlines first)\n        var line_iter = std.mem.splitScalar(u8, self.text, '\\n');\n        while (line_iter.next()) |logical_line| {\n            if (y >= max_y) break;\n\n            // Apply wrapping to this logical line\n            switch (self.wrap) {\n                .none => {\n                    self.renderLine(logical_line, area.x, y, area.width, buf);\n                    y += 1;\n                },\n                .char => {\n                    var remaining = logical_line;\n                    while (remaining.len > 0 and y < max_y) {\n                        const chunk_len = @min(remaining.len, area.width);\n                        const chunk = remaining[0..chunk_len];\n                        self.renderLine(chunk, area.x, y, area.width, buf);\n                        remaining = remaining[chunk_len..];\n                        y += 1;\n                    }\n                    // Empty line should still take a row\n                    if (logical_line.len == 0) {\n                        y += 1;\n                    }\n                },\n                .word => {\n                    if (logical_line.len == 0) {\n                        y += 1;\n                        continue;\n                    }\n                    var line_start: usize = 0;\n                    while (line_start < logical_line.len and y < max_y) {\n                        const wrap_end = findWordWrapEnd(logical_line[line_start..], area.width);\n                        const line = logical_line[line_start .. line_start + wrap_end];\n                        self.renderLine(line, area.x, y, area.width, buf);\n                        line_start += wrap_end;\n                        // Skip leading spaces on next line\n                        while (line_start < logical_line.len and logical_line[line_start] == ' ') {\n                            line_start += 1;\n                        }\n                        y += 1;\n                    }\n                },\n            }\n        }\n    }\n\n    /// Render a single line of text with alignment\n    fn renderLine(self: Paragraph, line: []const u8, x: u16, y: u16, width: u16, buf: *Buffer) void {\n        if (line.len == 0) return;\n\n        const text_len = text_mod.displayWidth(line);\n        const visible_len = @min(text_len, width);\n\n        if (visible_len == 0) return;\n\n        const x_offset: u16 = switch (self.alignment) {\n            .left => 0,\n            .center => (width -| visible_len) / 2,\n            .right => width -| visible_len,\n        };\n\n        buf.setString(x +| x_offset, y, line, self.style);\n    }\n};\n\n/// Find the end index for word wrapping within a max width.\n/// Returns the number of characters to include on this line.\nfn findWordWrapEnd(text: []const u8, max_width: u16) usize {\n    if (text.len == 0) return 0;\n\n    const width: usize = @intCast(max_width);\n    if (text.len <= width) return text.len;\n\n    // Find the last space within the width limit\n    var last_space: ?usize = null;\n    for (0..width) |i| {\n        if (text[i] == ' ') {\n            last_space = i;\n        }\n    }\n\n    // If we found a space, wrap there (include the space in this line)\n    if (last_space) |space_pos| {\n        // Return position including the space, so next line starts after it\n        return space_pos + 1;\n    }\n\n    // No space found - break at max width (hard wrap)\n    return width;\n}\n\n\n// ============================================================\n// SANITY TESTS - Basic Paragraph functionality\n// ============================================================\n\ntest \"sanity: Paragraph with default values\" {\n    const para = Paragraph{ .text = \"Hello\\nWorld\" };\n    try std.testing.expectEqualStrings(\"Hello\\nWorld\", para.text);\n    try std.testing.expect(para.style.isEmpty());\n    try std.testing.expect(para.wrap == .none);\n    try std.testing.expect(para.alignment == .left);\n}\n\ntest \"sanity: Paragraph with custom style\" {\n    const para = Paragraph{\n        .text = \"Styled\",\n        .style = Style.init().bold().fg(.red),\n    };\n    try std.testing.expect(para.style.hasAttribute(.bold));\n}\n\ntest \"sanity: Paragraph with wrap modes\" {\n    const none_wrap = Paragraph{ .text = \"T\", .wrap = .none };\n    const char_wrap = Paragraph{ .text = \"T\", .wrap = .char };\n    const word_wrap = Paragraph{ .text = \"T\", .wrap = .word };\n\n    try std.testing.expect(none_wrap.wrap == .none);\n    try std.testing.expect(char_wrap.wrap == .char);\n    try std.testing.expect(word_wrap.wrap == .word);\n}\n\ntest \"sanity: Paragraph with alignment\" {\n    const left = Paragraph{ .text = \"L\", .alignment = .left };\n    const center = Paragraph{ .text = \"C\", .alignment = .center };\n    const right = Paragraph{ .text = \"R\", .alignment = .right };\n\n    try std.testing.expect(left.alignment == .left);\n    try std.testing.expect(center.alignment == .center);\n    try std.testing.expect(right.alignment == .right);\n}\n\n// ============================================================\n// BEHAVIOR TESTS - Rendering\n// ============================================================\n\ntest \"behavior: Paragraph renders single line\" {\n    var buf = try Buffer.init(std.testing.allocator, 20, 5);\n    defer buf.deinit();\n\n    const para = Paragraph{ .text = \"Hello\" };\n    para.render(Rect.init(0, 0, 20, 5), &buf);\n\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(@as(u21, 'H'), buf.get(0, 0).char);\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(@as(u21, 'e'), buf.get(1, 0).char);\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(@as(u21, 'l'), buf.get(2, 0).char);\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(@as(u21, 'l'), buf.get(3, 0).char);\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(@as(u21, 'o'), buf.get(4, 0).char);\n}\n\ntest \"behavior: Paragraph renders multiple lines with newlines\" {\n    var buf = try Buffer.init(std.testing.allocator, 20, 5);\n    defer buf.deinit();\n\n    const para = Paragraph{ .text = \"Line1\\nLine2\\nLine3\" };\n    para.render(Rect.init(0, 0, 20, 5), &buf);\n\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(@as(u21, 'L'), buf.get(0, 0).char);\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(@as(u21, '1'), buf.get(4, 0).char);\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(@as(u21, 'L'), buf.get(0, 1).char);\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(@as(u21, '2'), buf.get(4, 1).char);\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(@as(u21, 'L'), buf.get(0, 2).char);\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(@as(u21, '3'), buf.get(4, 2).char);\n}\n\ntest \"behavior: Paragraph with char wrap\" {\n    var buf = try Buffer.init(std.testing.allocator, 10, 5);\n    defer @import(\"../style.zig\");\n\npub const Buffer = buffer_mod.Buffer;\npub const Cell = buffer_mod.Cell;\npub const Rect = geometry.Rect;\npub const Style = style_mod.Style;\n\n/// Tabs widget displaying a horizontal tab bar.\n///\n/// Renders a row of tab titles with the selected tab highlighted.\n/// Tabs are separated by a configurable divider string.\npub const Tabs = struct {\n    /// Tab titles to display\n    titles: []const []const u8,\n\n    /// Index of the currently selected tab\n    selected: usize = 0,\n\n    /// Default style for unselected tabs\n    style: Style = Style.empty,\n\n    /// Style for the selected tab\n    highlight_style: Style = Style.init().bold().fg(.yellow),\n\n    /// Divider string between tabs\n    divider: []const u8 = \" | \",\n\n    /// Render the tabs into the buffer at the given area.\n    /// Tabs are rendered horizontally on the first row of the area.\n    pub fn render(self: Tabs, area: Rect, buf: *Buffer) void {\n        if (area.isEmpty()) return;\n        if (self.titles.len == 0) return;\n\n        var x = area.x;\n\n        for (self.titles, 0..) |title, idx| {\n            if (x >= area.right()) break;\n\n            // Determine if this tab is selected\n            const is_selected = idx == self.selected;\n            const tab_style = if (is_selected) self.highlight_style else self.style;\n\n            // Render tab title\n            const available_width = area.right() -| x;\n            if (available_width == 0) break;\n\n            const title_len = textDisplayWidth(title);\n            const render_len = @min(title_len, available_width);\n\n            if (render_len > 0) {\n                buf.setString(x, area.y, title, tab_style);\n            }\n\n            x +|= 0x11FF);\n}","newString":"","originalFile":"// Tabs widget for zithril TUI framework\n// Tab bar with titles, selection, and customizable divider\n\nconst std = @import(\"std\");\nconst buffer_mod = @import(\"../buffer.zig\");\nconst geometry = @import(\"../geometry.zig\");\nconst style_mod = @import(\"../style.zig\");\nconst text_mod = @import(\"../text.zig\");\n\npub const Buffer = buffer_mod.Buffer;\npub const Cell = buffer_mod.Cell;\npub const Rect = geometry.Rect;\npub const Style = style_mod.Style;\n\n/// Tabs widget displaying a horizontal tab bar.\n///\n/// Renders a row of tab titles with the selected tab highlighted.\n/// Tabs are separated by a configurable divider string.\npub const Tabs = struct {\n    /// Tab titles to display\n    titles: []const []const u8,\n\n    /// Index of the currently selected tab\n    selected: usize = 0,\n\n    /// Default style for unselected tabs\n    style: Style = Style.empty,\n\n    /// Style for the selected tab\n    highlight_style: Style = Style.init().bold().fg(.yellow),\n\n    /// Divider string between tabs\n    divider: []const u8 = \" | \",\n\n    /// Render the tabs into the buffer at the given area.\n    /// Tabs are rendered horizontally on the first row of the area.\n    pub fn render(self: Tabs, area: Rect, buf: *Buffer) void {\n        if (area.isEmpty()) return;\n        if (self.titles.len == 0) return;\n\n        var x = area.x;\n\n        for (self.titles, 0..) |title, idx| {\n            if (x >= area.right()) break;\n\n            // Determine if this tab is selected\n            const is_selected = idx == self.selected;\n            const tab_style = if (is_selected) self.highlight_style else self.style;\n\n            // Render tab title\n            const available_width = area.right() -| x;\n            if (available_width == 0) break;\n\n            const title_len = text_mod.displayWidth(title);\n            const render_len = @min(title_len, available_width);\n\n            if (render_len > 0) {\n                buf.setString(x, area.y, title, tab_style);\n            }\n\n            x +|= @intCast(render_len);\n\n            // Render divider after tab (except for last tab)\n            if (idx + 1 < self.titles.len and x < area.right()) {\n                const divider_available = area.right() -| x;\n                const divider_len = text_mod.displayWidth(self.divider);\n                const divider_render_len = @min(divider_len, divider_available);\n\n                if (divider_render_len > 0) {\n                    buf.setString(x, area.y, self.divider, self.style);\n                }\n\n                x +|= @intCast(divider_render_len);\n            }\n        }\n    }\n\n    /// Get the number of tabs\n    pub fn count(self: Tabs) usize {\n        return self.titles.len;\n    }\n\n    /// Check if tabs are empty\n    pub fn isEmpty(self: Tabs) bool {\n        return self.titles.len == 0;\n    }\n\n    /// Get the selected tab index, clamped to valid range\n    pub fn selectedClamped(self: Tabs) ?usize {\n        if (self.titles.len == 0) return null;\n        return @min(self.selected, self.titles.len - 1);\n    }\n};\n\n/// Calculate the display width of a string.\nfn text_mod.displayWidth(str: []const u8) u16 {\n    var width: u16 = 0;\n    var iter = std.unicode.Utf8View.initUnchecked(str).iterator();\n    while (iter.nextCodepoint()) |cp| {\n        width +|= if (isWideCodepoint(cp)) 2 else 1;\n    }\n    return width;\n}\n\n/// Check if a codepoint is a wide character (CJK, etc.)\nfn isWideCodepoint(cp: u21) bool {\n    return (cp >= 0x4E00 and cp <= 0x9FFF) or\n        (cp >= 0x3400 and cp <= 0x4DBF) or\n        (cp >= 0x20000 and cp <= 0x2A6DF) or\n        (cp >= 0xF900 and cp <= 0xFAFF) or\n        (cp >= 0xFF00 and cp <= 0xFF60) or\n        (cp >= 0xFFE0 and cp <= 0xFFE6) or\n        (cp >= 0x3000 and cp <= 0x303F) or\n        (cp >= 0x1100 and cp <= 0x11FF);\n}\n\n// ============================================================\n// SANITY TESTS - Basic Tabs functionality\n// .titles = &titles };\n\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(@as(usize, 3), tabs.count());\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(@as(usize, 0), tabs.selected);\n    try std.testing.expectEqualStrings(\" | \", tabs.divider);\n}\n\ntest \"sanity: Tabs with selection\" {\n    const titles = [_][]const u8{ \"A\", \"B\", \"C\" };\n    const tabs = Tabs{\n        .titles = &titles,\n        .selected = 1,\n    };\n\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(@as(usize, 1), tabs.selected);\n}\n\ntest \"sanity: Tabs with custom styles\" {\n    const titles = [_][]const u8{\"X\"};\n    const tabs = Tabs{\n        .titles try std.testing.expect(!tabs.isEmpty());\n\n    const empty_titles = [_][]const u8{};\n    const empty_tabs = Tabs{ .titles = &empty_titles };\n\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(@as(usize, 0),
